column4: Hey, I'm trying to install the driver for my Radeon x300- but when I use sh to run the .run file, I get this:
default:v2:i686:lib::none:2.6.28-14-generic; make sure that the version is being
check out the README or INSTALL file that should have come with what you downloaded.
I'm pretty sure it only came iwth the .run
I followed a few links and found something useful, but it's telling me to Enable the accelerated ATI graphics driver in Hardware Drivers, which is currently empty.
mm, I don't know. I'm sorry you have to go through this. I did once with an ATI card and it drove me insane. (I gave up)
It's a hair-pulling experience, isn't it?
Well, not yet but I haven't been at it long yet.
ATI does have a wiki with some help for ubuntu. Check it out if you haven't.
